bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to L. O. Howard, August 24, 1900

div1.p: Reed sends Howard more specimens of mosquitoes that Lazear collected in Cuba. Reed is anxious to know the results. Included is a list of the types of mosquitoes collected. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to L. O. Howard, August 24, 1900
div1.opener:
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
* 1934 *
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
Three Centimeters
RECORDS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, Bureau of
Entomology and Plant Quarantine.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
August 24
Dear Mr Howard:
div1.p:
I beg
to send herewith for
examination and identi-
fication a second lot
of mosquitoes which
Lazear has collected
for our Board now
investigating Tropical Infectious
Diseases on the Island
of Cuba. We are
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
* 1934 *
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
Three Centimeters
RECORDS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, Bureau of
Entomology and Plant Quarantine.
anxious to know if the
mosquitoes marked
Dr Finlay 1 - Quemados, 1.
Marianao, 1 - Pinar del
Rio, 6 - are identical,
& if they are correctly
classed as “Culex”.

closer.seg:
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
* 1934 *
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
Three Centimeters
RECORDS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, Bureau of
Entomology and Plant Quarantine.
SMITHSONIAN INSTITUTION.
UNITED STATES NATIONAL MUSEUM.
-------------
MEMORANDUM.
Dr. Finlay's, Culex fasciatus Fabs.
Marianao, " " "
Quemados, " " "
Pinar del Rio, 1, " perturbans Walk., and 6. pungens Wild.
" " " 2, Limnobia sp.
" " " 3, 4 and 5, Culex perturbans Walk.
" " " 6, Culex fasciatus Fabs.
Havana, 1, Geranomyia rufesecne Loen.
" 2, Culex pungens Wild.
Port Hospital, Geranomyia rostrata say.
